case.name: Deleting Blazer
case.description: Monika tries to create a special way of removing her blazer by deleting it. This also happens to take her cardigan with it.

notes.note: If you name yourself something Monika dislikes and then start the game, this case plays. You can substitute ~marker.RealName~ for ~player~ at any point to have Monika use the player's "real" name (the last acceptable name they used, or Player if there was none) to give them a surprise later on.
If you change your name to something Monika approves of, this case will play and store the name you chose in the marker RealName.
If you start the game named Daddy with Natsuki present, this case plays.

If you name yourself something Monika doesn't like (currently: Master, Daddy), she tells you to go back and change it. You can change which names she dislikes by adding or removing the OR conditions, but unfortunately you have to remember to do it in all the cases that use them.
This sets a marker, FakeName, which stores the inappropriate name you chose so that Monika knows what you picked last time. Use ~marker.FakeName~ to put the name in dialogue. After the game starts, FakeName will be cleared.
Monika has a special reprimand if you call yourself "Daddy" when Natsuki is present. This sets the marker NatsukiDaddy, which indicates that you previously called yourself Daddy with Natsuki around.
If you change from a name Monika dislikes to another name Monika also dislikes, this case will play.
If you named yourself something Monika doesn't like and then change it to something better, this case plays.
If you come back to the select screen without changing your name, or re-select Monika, after she told you to change your name, this case plays.
If you re-select Monika with Natsuki present and are still called Daddy, this case plays.
A version of Monika's reprimand for you if you select Natsuki while already called Daddy. Also sets the NatsukiDaddy marker.
If you previously named yourself Daddy with Natsuki present, Monika acknowledges that your new name is less offensive, but still wants you to change it.

If you change your name to "Mister" or "Miss", Monika teases you for being mysterious. This doesn't store "Mister" or "Miss" in RealName, so she'll continue to remember you as whatever "real" name you've used in the past.
Repurposed this as a marker-trick case for noticing changes in the player's gender. It will no longer play unless the player actually changed their gender.

This case will only play if the player has not changed their gender from their previous game. I'm not sure if knows_player_gender is used for anything other than an old-fashioned play once, but just in case, I'm making sure it's always set like it used to be.
This should only play the very first time that Monika notices the player's gender. After that, one of the other cases will check to see if it's changed or not.
This should only play the very first time that Monika notices the player's gender. After that, one of the other cases will check to see if it's changed or not.
Repurposed this as a marker-trick case for noticing changes in the player's gender. It will no longer play unless the player actually changed their gender.

This case will only play if the player has not changed their gender from their previous game. I'm not sure if knows_player_gender is used for anything other than an old-fashioned play once, but just in case, I'm making sure it's always set like it used to be.
Monika notices you reset the game before three rounds had even passed. This also clears isPlaying.
Monika notices you reset the game after three or more rounds. This also clears isPlaying.
Monika notices you reset the game after three or more rounds. This also clears isPlaying.
If you reset the game before three rounds pass and then change your name, this case will play.
If you reset the game after three rounds pass and then change your name, this case will play.
Version of the Mister/Miss case where the played has also just reset the game.

markers.marker: Counts the number of times the player has reset a game without finishing it. Not used for anything yet.
Monika tries to create a special way of removing her blazer, but it deletes her cardigan as well.
Monika has said at least one of her "Oops" lines in response to a round glitch.
Stores a name you picked that Monika doesn't like. This will be cleared after the game actually starts.
In this game, the player has changed their gender from female to male, and Monika has noticed.
Monika has glitched a round of gameplay. This includes the current round and any previous rounds.

Someone in the round is being affected by the 'corruption' glitch, causing their dialogue to be corrupted either with 'zalgotext' characters or by making their dialogue text overflow the speech bubble boundaries.

Someone in the round is being affected by the 'deletion' glitch, causing their character sprite to be replaced by glitch blocks, replacing their character label with glitch characters, and partially corrupting their dialogue.
Someone in the round is being affected by the 'edit' glitch, causing their text to appear with a modified style mimicking the 'edited dialogue' effect from DDLC.
Someone in the round is being affected by the 'visual' glitch, causing their character sprite to alternate between their normal sprite and a corrupted version.
Keeps track of the current game state for Monika's reset awareness. Current possible values: start, playing.
Monika has said at least one of her "I didn't know you were a guy/girl" lines.
In this game, the player has changed their gender from male to female, and Monika has noticed.
You've named yourself Daddy with Natsuki present. This will be cleared after the game actually starts.
Stores your "real name", which is the last name you used that Monika liked. If you've never used a name she approved of, "Player" will be stored here.
Flag for Monika's stage 0 "must strip" line towards Mahiru.
Flag for Monika's stage 0 "must strip" line towards Pit.
Flag for Monika's stage 0 "stripping" line towards Mahiru.
Flag for Monika's stage 10 "finished" line towards Mahiru.
Flag for Monika's stage 10 "finished" line towards Pit.
Flag for Monika's stage 1 "stripped" line towards Mahiru.
Flag for Monika's stage 1 "stripped" line towards Pit.
Flag for Monika's stage 1 "stripping" line towards Pit.
Flag for Monika's stage 3 "stripping" line towards Mahiru.
Flag for Monika's stage 3 "stripping" line towards Pit. The CE currently can't deserialize this line properly. Sorry!
Flag for Monika's stage 4 "stripped" line towards Mahiru. The CE currently can't deserialize this line properly. Sorry!
Flag for Monika's stage 4 "stripped" line towards Pit.
Flag for Monika's stage 4 "stripping" line towards Mahiru. The CE currently can't deserialize this line properly. Sorry!
Flag for Monika's stage 4 "stripping" line towards Pit.
Flag for Monika's stage 6 "stripped" line towards Mahiru. The CE currently can't deserialize this line properly. Sorry!
Flag for Monika's stage 6 "stripped" line towards Pit.
Flag for Monika's stage 7 "stripped" line towards Pit.
Flag for Monika's stage 8 "stripped" line towards Mahiru.
Flag for Monika's stage 8 "stripped" line towards Pit. The CE currently can't deserialize this line properly. Sorry!
Monika is glitching the current round of gameplay. This is set and unset at the very beginning of each round, before anyone speaks.
Stores the player's gender across games; Monika will notice if it changes. Possible stored values are "male" and "female".
